sections.heading: AssessmentNew
sections.summary: Understanding what stage of menopause the individual is in will help influence management options.Perimenopause, also known as “the menopause transition”, begins when people experience menopause-associated symptoms and/or can be accompanied by changes in their menstrual cycle. It is an important time for preventative care, as it can be associated with increased risk of cardiovascular disease and bone loss. This stage can last up to 10 years. sections.summary: Menopausal hormone therapyMedications tableNon-hormonal therapyNon-pharmacological therapyReferrals Menopausal hormone therapy (MHT) is the most effective option for managing vasomotor symptoms in women and people experiencing menopause and perimenopause. MHT can be safely initiated in individuals without contraindications who are younger than 60 years of age or less than 10 years post-menopause. sections.summary: Assess breast cancer risk to help with shared decision-making treatment option.
